Posts.Content: colby9204 wrote: I had my lumpectomy yesterday- they ended up removing two lumps that were back to back, and now I'm awaiting results.   I am upset today, worried to death, and ALONE.-- yesterday I was surrounded by friends because I guess it was "surgery day," but now it is the day after and I'm alone.  All of my friends went to various "stuff" (football games, a theatre competition to be spectators, etc.) I'm so angry with all of them right now b/c I didn't feel like even getting off the couch today and not one offered to be there today.  It was kind of like, they'll be there for me...as long as they don't have other plans.  I'm trying not to be angry because I know it's not their job to be there, but it just...well, it sucks.  I'm worried and alone, and I kind of hate this day. I am trying to keep my mind off of it, to watch movies and just breathe.  I don't feel good from having surgery yesterday, and all my mind can think of is how let down I feel by everyone in my life for walking out the second day.  It's just, I feel in my mind I should just be grateful they were there yesterday...but I'm not.  I'm upset. Sorry for the rant...just am glad there are people on here to listen.  Thanks to everyone on here for all the kind words you've already given me, and I'm praying for you guys, too. Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2009 11:09AM colby9204 wrote: Anne and bf, I'm totally with you right now.  Other people's optimism, at this moment, is just pissing me off.  I know they are only trying to help, but to me, it's like not validating my worry.  I'm also on a rollercoaster- one moment, I'm not as worried, but for example, this morning, I'm a nervous wreck.  They'd told my biopsy results would be in by Tuesday, but they called from the dr. office this morning to remind me of my appt. tomorrow to check incision site and said results still weren't back.  Now I'm being all ridiculous and analyzing the fact that they aren't in...does that mean something??  Good something?  Bad something?  I feel crazy.
Posts.Title: Dealing with waiting alone colby9204 bugdm

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2009 02:30PM colby9204 wrote: Thanks, all.  I am feeling better emotionally this morning.  My best friend called and I feel bad now because I basically railed at him for not being there yesterday.  He was nearly in tears and apologized, and said, "I had no idea you needed me that much."  It just made me feel a ton better to get it all out.  Physically, I'm not feeling to bad- I'm painful, but they gave me meds which help some.  It kind of feels like my chest is on fire if I don't take the meds, so I have taken them even though they make me a bit loopy.  On the whole, though, I just feel wiped out, physically and emotionally.  I'm quite ready to get the results so I can move on one way or the other.  That;s the hard thing about waiting- you're stuck in limbo and can take no action either way...just sitting, imagination running wild. Hope you're going to get some sleep today, Anne.  I'm with you on the exhaustion!  Even though the meds make me groggy, if I do sleep it's not seeming to be "Good" sleep...restless.
